result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen Nathan Cook

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Chapman indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

11:42 AM Defendant Stephen Nathan Cook in court.  Attorney Daniel Chapman appears in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through Attorney, DEF to waive preliminary hearing.   Bond Conditions.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:28 AM   Defendant STEPHEN N COOK appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail  Attorney Chapman appears in court.  Jennifer Gross appears for the State.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State indicates no report has been received.  Attny Chapman addresses DEF.  Attny Chapman makes statement.   Court reset.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:50 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

COOK, STEPHEN N     CASE:  T22100601

Possession w/intent Methamphetamines
Bail/bond hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:33 AM DE Stephen Cook in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video. Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak no objection.  Court has discussion with State regarding PC Statement.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy.  Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 10/11/2022 at 8:30AM.  

CBS $1,500    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received notification from Public Defenders Office, DEF does not qualify for PD appointment, and was given instructions to contact Clerk of Court Office to apply for court appointed attorney.
